Order Release Overview

The release process enables the allocations to be sent to the downstream fulfillment systems such as Warehouse Management (WM) or store fulfillment systems, so that the order can be shipped or picked up. When an order is released, a release object is created and sent to fulfillment systems. This release object contains release lines, which define the items and quantities to be shipped or picked up, in addition to the key information needed to fulfill the order like destination address, carrier, and service level.

Once an allocation is released, late order cancellation and order modification (only changing shipping address) are supported. Any other modification to an already released allocation is possible only if the fulfillment system responds by shorting the release to give back ownership to the Order Management system.
